src_text: Vuvekisi Khabinete yi amukela Foramu ya Vuvekisi ya Afrika leyi simekiweke yi famba kahle leyi khomiweke kusuka hi siku ra 7 kufika 9 Hukuri 2018 eSandton Convention Centre eGauten Mifumo ya Afrika na mabindzu, mihlangano ya swa timali ya matiko ya misava na vatirhisani va nhluvukiso van'wana va kongomise eka ku endla Afrika yi va rirhangu ra matiko ya misava leri landzelaka eka vuvekis Eku pfaleni ka khomferense 45 wa mitwanano, leyi nga na nkoka wa US$32 wa tibiliyoni, ku ngheniwile eka yona ku vuyerisa tikokul Eka sweswo, Afrika-Dzonga yi ta vuyeriwa kusuka eka US$wa tibiliyoni eka vuvekisi Samiti ya Yuniyoni ya Afrika (AU) Khabinete yi khutaziwa hi mikanerisano eka Samiti ya AU leyi khomeriweke eAddis Ababa, Ethiopia hi siku ra 17 na 18 Hukuri 2018, laha Phuresidente Cyril Ramaphosa a tekeke xiav Nhlengeletano leyo ka yi nga Tolovelakangi eka tiphurosese ta mpfuxeto leti yaka emahlweni leti a ti kunguhateriwile ku tumbuluxa AU leyi tirhaka kahle, leyi nga tlangisiki swipfuno na ku va leyi nyikiweke matimba hi vuntshwa leyi kotaka ku fikelela swirhangana swa tikokulu na swikongomelokulu leswi hlamuseriweke eka Ajenda 2063, leswi swi nga rimba ra maqhinga eka ncinco wa vaaki na ikhonomi wa Afrika eka 50 wa malembe lama tak Mpfuxeto wa AU i phurosese leyi yaka emahlweni, laha swin'wana swa swibumabumelo swa yona se swi tirhisiweke, ngopfungopfu hi ku fambelana na vutiboheleri bya ku va na mifumo leyi nga swirho swa AU yi byarha vun'wini lebyikulu bya ku nyika timali eka nhlangano low
trg_text: Investment Cabinet welcomes the successful inaugural Africa Investment Forum held from 7 to 9 November 2018 at the Sandton Convention Centre in Gauten African governments and businesses, international financial institutions and other development partners focused on making Africa the next global frontier in investmen At the close of the conference 45 deals, worth US$32 billion, were concluded to benefit the continen Of that, South Africa will benefit from US$billion in investment African Union (AU) Summit Cabinet is encouraged by deliberations at the AU Summit held in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia on 17 and 18 November 2018, where President Cyril Ramaphosa participate The Extraordinary Session deliberated on the ongoing reform processes which are intended to establish an effective, efficient and re-energized AU that is capable of achieving continental priorities and goals set out in Agenda 2063, which is a strategic framework for the socio-economic transformation of Africa over the next 50 year The reform of the AU is an ongoing process, with some of its recommendations already implemented, particularly in relation to the commitment to have member states of the AU assume greater ownership of financing the organisatio

src_text: Matiko yo tala ya ya emahlweni ya sayina Ntwanano wa Mabindzu ya Nkaswipimelo ya Tikokulu ra Afrika ku tiyisisa leswaku Tikokulu ri humelerisa ntwanano wa mabindzu ya nkaswipimelo ya tikokulu hinkwaro Vutirhisani bya Xiqhinga na Yniyoni ya Yuropa (EU) Khabinete ya tsaka hi mbuyelo lowunene wa Samiti ya Afrika-Dzonga
trg_text: More countries continue to sign the African Continental Free Trade Agreement to ensure the Continent realises the continent-wide free-trade agreement Strategic Partnership with the European Union (EU) Cabinet is pleased with the positive outcome of the 7th South Africa

src_text: EU ya vu7 leyi khomiweke hi siku ra 15 Hukuri eBelgim Mivuyelo na vutiboheleri lebyi endliweke eka samiti ku aka ehenhla ka pfhumba leri nga si tshama ri vakona ku veka ku kula ka ikhonomi na ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho exikarhi ka ajenda ya rixaka ya Afrika-Dzong Afrika-Dzonga i tiko ra Afrika ri ri roxe naswona hi rin'wana ra matiko ya 10 emisaveni hinkwayo leri nga na Xinakulobye xa Xiqhinga na E EU i mutirhisani wo bindzurisa lonkulu wa Afrika-Dzonga naswona i muvekisi wa matiko mambe lonkulu tanihi biloko, leyi yimelaka 7 ta switoko hikwaswo swa Vuvekisi byo Kongoma bya Matiko Mambe etikwen Phuresidente Ramaphosa vhiki reri u rhurhele Phuresidente xa Rhiphabuliki ya Xifederali ya Jarimani, Ttn Frank-Walter Steinmeier, eka Vuendzeri bya Mfumo eka Afrika-Dzong Jarimani hi yin'wana ya vavekisi va matiko mambe lavakulu eAfrika-Dzonga, leyi nga na kutlula 6000 wa tikhamphani ta Jarimani leti nga na marhavu kumbe vuhumesi etikweni, yi hlayisa kwalomu ka 100 000 wa mitirh Vuendzeri lebya Mfumo byi vange ku sayiniwa ka mitwanano ya mabindzu na vuvekisi exikarhi ka matiko lamambirhi, naswona byi kotise varhangeri havambirhi ku kanela hi swiphiqo swa matikonyingi na ku tirhisana swinene tanihi swirho leswi nga riki swa nkarhi hinkwawo swa Khansele ya Nsirhelelo ya Vun'we bya Tinxaka (UN) ku ringana theme ya malembe mambirhi kusuka hi 2019 kufika hi 202 Mpfuxeto wa misava Khabinete yi lemuke leswaku Komiti ya Nkambisiso wa Vumbiwa ya Nhlanganelo ya Palamende yi amukele xiviko xa yona lexi xi seketelaka ku hundzuluxiwa ka Xiyenge xa 25 xa Vumbiwa ra Rhiphabuliki ya Afrika-Dzonga ra 1996.
trg_text: EU Summit held on 15 November in Belgiu The outcomes and commitments made at the summit build on our unprecedented drive to place economic growth and job creation at the centre of South Africa s national agend South Africa is the only African country and one of the 10 countries globally that has a Strategic Partnership with the E The EU is South Africa s largest trading partner and largest foreign investor as a bloc, representing 7 of total Foreign Direct Investment stocks in the countr President Ramaphosa this week hosted the President of the Federal Republic of Germany, Mr Frank-Walter Steinmeier, on a State Visit to South Afric Germany is one of the largest foreign investors in South Africa, with more than 600 German companies having subsidiaries or production in the country, sustaining about 100 000 job This State Visit resulted in the signing of trade and investment agreements between the two countries, and afforded both leaders an opportunity to discuss multilateral issues and cooperate closely as non-permanent members of the United Nations (UN) Security Council for a two-year term from 2019 to 202 Land reform Cabinet noted that Parliament s Joint Constitutional Review Committee adopted its report that is in favour of amending Section 25 of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.

src_text: Hundzuluxo lowu wu ta endla swi koteka eka Mfumo ku teka vun'wini bya misava ku ri hava ndziriso ku vuyerisa vaak Xiviko xa komiti xi languteriwa ku andlariwa eka Huvo ya Rixaka eka njhekajekisan Phurosese yo tinhlanganisa na vaaki yi endle mihlangano yo tala yi rhumela swibumabumelo eka Nawumbisi lowu naswona tinhlengeletano to twa miehleketo ya vaaki ti khomiwile eka swifundzakulu swa hinkwasw Vumbiwa kufika sweswi ri hundzuluxiwile ka 17 hi phurosese yo tihlanganisa na ku katsa vanhu hinkwav Mfumo wu tshama wa ha tibohe eka endlelo ra mpfuxeto wa misava lowu nga na vutihlamuleri leri nga ta vuyerisa munhu un'wana na un'wan Khabinete ya tiyisisa leswaku mfumo wu xixima mfumo wa nawu naswona, hi mikarhi hinkwayo, wu ta endla hi ku fambisana na Vumbiw
trg_text: The amendment will make it possible for the State to expropriate land without compensation in the public interes The committee s report is expected to be tabled in the National Assembly for debat A public consultation process saw numerous organisations making submissions on the Bill and public hearings were held in all nine province The Constitution has so far been amended 17 times through a consultative and inclusive proces Government remains committed to a responsible land reform approach that is in the best interests of everyon Cabinet affirms that government respects the rule of law and will, at all times, act in accordance with the Constitutio

src_text: Vuahluri bya Khoto ya Vumbiwa Khabinete yi amukela vuahluri bya Khoto ya Vumbiwa leyi boheke leswaku Nawu wa Swicelwa na Nhluvukiso wa Swipfuno swa Oyilimbisi, 2020 (Nawu wa 28 wa 2002) lowu wu fumaka ku nyikiwa ka timfanelo ta vucelamigodi, wu fanele ku hlayiwa swin'we na Nawu wa Nsirhelelo wa Timfanelo ta Misava leti nga riki ta Ximfumo, 1996 (Nawu wa 31 wa 1996), lowu wu sirhelelaka timfanelo ta misava leti nga sirhelelekangik Vuhluri bya muganga wa Lesetlheng eN'walungu-Vupeladyambu wu komba masungulo ya timfanelo ta misava leti vanhu lava a va tshikeleriwile emikarhini leyi nga hundza va Afrika-Dzonga a va pfumatiwile tona eka tinxaka to hlay Laha vucelamigodi byi hlohlotela eka matshamelo, mindyangu na miganga, vanhu lava khumbekaka hi ku kongoma hi vucelamigodi va fanele ku pfumela ku cinca kwihi kumbe kwihi loku khumbaka timfanelo ta vona ta misava Mivuyelo ya oditi Khabinete yi amukela na ku hoyozela tindzawulo na mavandla ya mfumo lama yaka emahlweni hindlela yo fanana ya ku kuma mivuyelo ya oditi yo bas Leswi swi ta endzhaku ka ku humesiwa hi Oditara-Jenerala (AG) Kimi Makwetu ka Xiviko xa Oditi ya Malawulelo ya Timali ta Mfumo xa lembeximali ra 2017/12.
trg_text: Constitutional Court judgement Cabinet welcomes the Constitutional Court judgment which ruled that the Minerals and Petroleum Resources Development Act, 2002 (Act 28 of 2002) which governs the awarding of mining rights, must be read concurrently with the Interim Protection of Informal Land Rights Act, 1996 (Act 31 of 1996), which protects vulnerable land right The victory of the Lesetlheng community in North West signals a start to the recognition of land rights of which South Africa s historically oppressed people had been deprived for generation Where mining impacts on settlements, families and communities, people directly affected by mining must consent to any changes affecting their land rights Audit outcomes Cabinet welcomes and congratulates the government departments and entities that continues to consistently receive clean- audit outcome

src_text: Hambisiwiritano Khabinete yi vilerisiwa hi xiviko lexi xi kombaka ku ya ehansi ko angarhela eka mivuyelo ya oditi ya tindzawulo tin'wana ta mfumo wa rixaka na wa swifundzakulu na mavandla ya ton Ku sayiniwa ku va nawu ka Nawumbisi wo Hundzuluxa wa Oditi ya Mfumo hi Phuresidente Ramaphosa, leswi swi nga ta tiyisa ntirho wa Hofisi ya AG, swi ta pfuna ku endla va tihlamulela lava va yaka emahlweni na ku tsan'wa rimba ra mfum Khabinete yi khutaza tindzawulo na mavandla hinkwawo ku tirha hi miphalalo yo lulamisa eka swiphiqo hinkwaswo leswi funghiweke hi AG na ku veka ndzima tihlo nkarhi na nkarhi ku tirhana na swiphiqo ku nga si fika ndzhendzeleko wa oditi ya nkarhi lowu tak
trg_text: This comes after the release by the Auditor General (AG) Kimi Makwetu of the Public Finance Management Audit Report of the 2017/18 financial yea Cabinet is however concerned with the report that shows an overall deterioration in the audit results of some national and provincial government departments and their entitie The signing into law of the Public Audit Amendment Bill by President Ramaphosa, which will strengthen the work of the Office of the AG, will assist in holding accountable those that continue to have disregard for the governance framewor Cabinet encourages all departments and entities to work on remedial interventions on all the issues flagged by the AG and to monitor progress regularly to address issues before the next audit cycl

src_text: Pfhumba leri ri kongomisa eka ku endla Afrika-Dzonga yi va ndhawu yo hlayiseka tanihiloko hi tshinelela nguva ya tiholideyi ta ku hela ka lemb Vukorhokeri bya Maphorisa bya Afrika-Dzonga byi ta endla mitirho etikweni hinkwaro edorobeni rin'wana na rin'wana, emugangeni na le lokixini kufikela ku hela ka Sunguti 2019.
trg_text: The campaign aims to make South Africa a safer place as we approach the year-end holiday seaso The South African Police Service will conduct nationwide operations in every town, village and township until the end of January 2019.They will focus on visible policing, whilst conducting special crime awareness and prevention operation Cabinet appeals to all people in South Africa to continue cooperating with the police in keeping our communities saf Parents and guardians are also advised to be extra vigilant in caring for their children during the upcoming festive seaso

src_text: Va ta kongomisa eka maphorisa lama vonakalaka, loko ku ri karhi ku endliwa mitirho ya vulemukisi na nsivelo wa vugevenga byo hlawulek Khabinete yi kombela vanhu hinkwavo eAfrika-Dzonga ku ya emahlweni va tirhisana na maphorisa eka ku endla miganga yi tshama yi hlayisekil Vatswari na vahlayisi va xinawu na vona va tsundzuxiwa ku va xa xalamuka swinene eka ku hlayisa vana va vona hi nkarhi wa nguva ya makhisimusi leyi nga eku ten
trg_text: The award is in recognition of her lifelong remarkable achievements and efforts in nurturing and furthering the cooperation between France and South Africa in the field of Science and Technolog The ceremony will be held in at the residence of the French Ambassador to South Africa in Pretori AppointmentsAll appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearanc Provincial heads of the Directorate for Priority Crime Investigation:1 Free State: Brigadier Kubandran Moodley; and1 North West: Major General Dumisani Patrick Mboth Reappointment of Adv Makhosini Solomon Msibi as the CEO of the Road Traffic Management Corporation (RTMC).

src_text: Nakambe Khabinete ya tiboha ku seketela pfhumba ra Vuhlayiseki bya le Magondzweni bya Nguva ya Makhisimusi, leri simekiweke hi Holobye wa Vutleketli, Dkd Blade Nzimande, eLimpopo hi ku hela ka vhik Nsimeko lowu wu kotlana na Samiti ya Vuhlayiseki bya le Magondzweni ya masiku mambirhi ya lembe na lembe na Siku ra ku Tsundzuka ra Misava ra UN ra lava weriweke hi khombo ra mitlumbano ya le magondzwen
trg_text: Cabinet also pledges support to the 2018 Festive Season Road Safety campaign, launched by the Minister of Transport, Dr Blade Nzimande, in Limpopo at the weeken The launch coincided with the annual two-day Road Safety Summit and the UN s World Day of Remembrance for victims of road crashe

src_text: Swi ta vuyerisa ku hanya kahle ka hina leswaku hinkwerhu hi tirha xiphemu eka ku tiyisisa leswaku ku va na nguva ya makhisimusi leyi hlayisekeke hi ku chayela hindlela ya vutihlamuleri na ku landzelela milawu ya gondzo Biloho ra Maputo-Catembe Khabinete yi hoyozela vainjhiniyara va Afrika-Dzonga lava khumbekeke eka nhluvukiso lowu nga wa nkoka eka matimu wa biloho ro cinkinya ro leha kutlula hinkwawo eAfrik Biloho ra Maputo-Catembe ri akiwile hi Khamphanikulu ya Magondzo na Mabiloho ya Chayina naswona ri khomanisa Maputo eMozambique na KwaZulu-Nata Phuresidente wa Mozambique, Ttn Filipe Nyusi, u pfule ximfumo Biloho ra Maputo-Catembe ro leha tikhilomitara tinharhu, leri ri akiweke hi mune wa malembe hi ndhurho wa US$785 wa timiliyon Nhluvukiso lowu wu ta hlohlotela mabindzu na vupfhumba exikarhi ka Mozambique na Afrika-Dzonga hi nkarhi wa ku tekiwa ka rendzo exikarhi ka Maputo kuya eka Hlaluko wa Kosi endzilakanini wa Ribuwu ra le Vuhumadyambu ra KwaZulu-Natal lowu hunguteke hindlela ya xiyimo xa le henhla kusuka eka tsevu wa tiawara kufika eka 90 wa timinet Swiboho swa Khabinete9.
trg_text: It is in the best interests of our well-being that we all play a part in ensuring a safer festive season by driving responsibly and obeying the rules of the road Maputo-Catembe Bridge Cabinet congratulates the South African engineers involved in the historic development of the longest suspension bridge in Afric The Maputo-Catembe Bridge was built by the China Road and Bridge Corporation and connects Maputo in Mozambique and KwaZulu-Nata President of Mozambique, Mr Filipe Nyusi, inaugurated the three-kilometre-long Maputo-Catembe Bridge, which was built over four years at a cost of US$785 millio This development will stimulate trade and tourism between Mozambique and South Africa with travel time between Maputo to Kosi Bay in KwaZulu-Natal s East Coast border post drastically reduced from six hours to 90 minute Cabinet decisions9.

src_text: Tindzawulo leti tirhaka exikarhi ka swikatsa leswi ku simeka 14 wa mivuyelo leya swirhangana ti ya emahlweni ti fikelela swiphakeriwa swa tona vin Mivuyelo leyi yi huma eka Rimba ra Maqhinga ra le Xikarhi ka Theme na kusuka eka Xivono xa 2030 xa Kungu ra Nhluvukiso ra Rixak Khabinete yi pasisile xibumabumelo xa goza leri lavekaka ku tirhana na mitlhontlho leyi khumbaka nsimek Swiviko leswi swi kandziyisiwle eka webusayiti ya DPME (wwdpmgoza).
trg_text: Departments working within the clusters to implement the 14 priority outcomes continue to achieve their respective deliverable These outcomes are derived from the 2014-2019 Medium Term Strategic Framework and from the National Development Plan s Vision 2032.

src_text: Nongonoko wa Vuhumesi na Nhluvukiso wa Swipandzamananga (APDP)1 Khabinete yi pasise ku engeteriwa ka APDP kusuka hi 2021 kufika hi 2035 hi mihundzuluxo ku seketela Kungukulu ra Swipandzamananga ra Afrika-Dzonga (SAAM)SAAM yi kongomisa eka swiyenge swa tsevu: Ku tirhisiwa hindlela leyi vuyerisaka makete wa le tikweni; Nhluvukiso wa makete wa Xifundza; Nhluvukiso wa swimakiwakulu; ncinco wa vumaki, na nhluvukiso wa thekinoloji na swikili leswi fambelanakaMihundzuluxo leyi exikarhi ka swin'wana yi lava ku hlohlotela tilevhele ta le henhla ta ku engeteriwa ka nkoka wa laha tikweni ku tumbuluxa swivandlanene swa mitirho yo engetel Vulanguteri na nkambelo wa nongonoko lowu na swiendleko swa vumaki leswi fambelanaka swa antswisiwa ku tiyisisa leswaku ku va na ndzima eka xivono na swikongomelo swa SAA 1 Holobye wa Mabindzu na Vumaki, Dkd Rob Davies, u ta nyika vuxokoxoko eka swihangalasamahungu hi mihundzuluxo leyi hi Ravuntlhanu, 23 Hukuri 2018.
trg_text: Banyana Banyana won their match against Nigeria at the 2018 Women s Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON)Bafana Bafana drew 1-1 in the AFCON qualifier match with NigeriaThe South African Rugby team is commended for their performances and we wish them well for their upcoming match against Wales on 24 November 2018.Cabinet calls on South Africans to continue to rally behind the country s sports women and me Cabinet also congratulates:1 Science and Technology Minister Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane, who has been nominated to serve in the World Economic Forum Council on the Fourth Industrial Revolution, which consists of government, civil society and academic This will help countries globally to respond and take advantage of opportunities presented by the Fourth Industrial RevolutionFinance Minister Tito Mboweni on his appointment to the Board of Trustees of the AU Peace Fund, which will finance mediation and preventative diplomacy activities, institutional capacity requirements, and peace support operations in Afric As a member of the Board of Trustees, Minister Mboweni will contribute towards the strategic coherence and enhanced governance, financial and administrative oversight of the Peace Fun The appointment of the trustees of the AU s Peace Fund is a key step in the implementation of the financing of the AU s agenda, which is part of the ongoing institutional reform processigher Education and Training Minister Naledi Pandor, who will be conferred with the French National Order of the Legion of Honour Award on Friday, 30 November 2018.

src_text: Khabinete yi pasise Nawumbisi wa Hakelo yo Engetela ya Oditi ya Mfumo wa 2018 (Public Audit Excess Fee Bill of 2018) leswaku wu andlariwa ePalamend Nawumbisi lowu wu lulamisela Oditara-Jenerala ku teka goza ro lulamisa ku tiyisisa leswaku milahleko leyi Mfumo wu hlanganaka na yona, laha swi kotekaka, yi vuyisiwa na ku kongomisa mihambuko yo tivikana leyi ehleketeleriwaka yo karhi eka vulavisis Nawumbisi lowu wu ya emahlweni ku lava ku nyika matimba eka AG ku tirha ntirho wa oditi ya matiko ya misava a ku endla tioditi ta matirhelo, na ku fambelanisa milulamiselo ya mafumelo ya AG eka maendlelo lamanene ya nkarhi wa swesw Swiendleko leswi Taka12.
trg_text: Cabinet approved for the Public Audit Excess Fee Bill of 2018 to be introduced in Parliamen The Bill supports changes to the regulation of fees for Auditor General functions in the Public Audit Amendment Act, assented to by the President and promulgated earlier this wee The Public Audit Excess Fee Bill proposes that audit fees in excess of 1% of expenditure of municipalities and certain other public institutions payable to the Auditor-General, be treated as a direct charge against the National Revenue Fun Upcoming events12.

src_text: 100 #WomenOfFortitudeEndzhaku ka nkarhi wa ku boxiwa ka mavito, 100 #WomenOfFortitude yi ta pfuriwa eUnion Buildings ePitori hi siku ra 22 Hukuri 2018.
trg_text: 100 #WomenOfFortitudeFollowing a period of nominations, the 100 #WomenOfFortitude will be unveiled at the Union Buildings in Pretoria on 22 November 2018.

src_text: Komiti ya le Xikarhi ka Tindzawulo eka Malembexidzana ya Nelson Mandela na Malembexidzana ya Albertina Sisulu yi tivise hi siku ra 11 Nhlangula 2018 pfhumba ra #WomenOfFortitude tanihi un'wana wa migingiriko ya Malembexidzana ya Manana SisulPfhumba ra #WomenOfFortitude i nhlangano wa 100 ra vavasati ra ku hlohlotela mbulavurisano wa hilaha vavasati namuntlha va nga yisaka emahlweni ndzhaka ya Manana Sisul 16 wa Masiku ya ku Lwisana na Madzolonga yo ya hi Rimbewu (GBV)Ndzawulo ya Vamanana yi le ku kondleteleni na ku katsakanya khalendara ya swiendleko ya mfumo eka Pfhumba ra 16 wa Masiku ya ku
trg_text: The Inter-Ministerial Committee on the Nelson Mandela Centenary and Centenary of AlbertinaSisulu announced on the 11 October 2018 the #WomenOfFortitude campaign as one of the Mama Sisulu Centenary activitieThe #WomenOfFortitude campaign is a movement of 100 women to drive the conversation of how women today can sustain the legacy of Mama Sisul 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence (GBV)The Department of Women is coordinating and consolidating government's calendar of events for the 16 Days of Activism against GBV Campaign from 25 November to 10 December 2018.

src_text: Khabinete yi hoyozela tinghwazi ta mitlangu hinkwato leti endlaka Afrika-Dzonga yi tinyungubyis Mifikelelo ya lavaya va tirheke kahle swinene etimbaleni ta vona ta mitlangu, yi amukeriwile eka nkhuvu wa Masagwati ya mitlangu wa 2018 lowu wa ha ku vaka kona ku nga ri khal
trg_text: Cabinet congratulates all local sporting heroes who are flying the South African flag hig The achievements of those who excelled in their respective sporting fields, was acknowledged at the recent 2018 Sports Award ceremonySouth Africa s Caster Semenya bagged double gold by winning the coveted Sports Star of the Year award along with the Sportswoman of the Year AwardSouth African swimming sensation Chad le Clos won the Sportsman of the Year AwardNdodomzi Ntutu won the Sportsman of the Year with Disability AwardAnrune Liebenberg won the Sportswoman of the Year with Disability Awar

src_text: 1 Caster Semenya wa Afrika-Dzonga u amukele misuku yimbirhi hi ku wina sagwati ra N'wamitlangu wa Lembe leri rhandziwaka ngopfu swin'we na Sagwati ra N'wamitlangu wa Xisati wa LembeMuhlamberi wa xiyimo xa le henhla wa Afrika-Dzonga Chad le Clos u wine Sagwati ra N'wamitlangu wa Xinuna wa LembeNdodomzi Ntutu u wine Sagwati ra N'wamitlangu wa Xinuna wa Lembe loyi a nga na VutsoniwaAnrune Liebenberg u wine Sgwati ra N'wamitlangu wa Xisati wa Lembe loyi a nga na Vutsoniw 1 Banyana Banyana u wine Sagwati ra Xipanu xa Lembe ra xiyimo xa le henhl
trg_text: Reappointment of Mr Thulani Matiki Norman Kgomo as non-executive member of the RTMC Boar Reappointment of Ms Daphline Harridene Charlotte-Ann Ewertse as non-executive member of the RTMC Boar Appointment of Adv Sandile Nogxina as Non-Executive Director and Chairperson of the Airport Company South Africa BoarEnquiries:Ms Phumla Williams

src_text: Banyana Banyana yi wine meche wa yona wo sungula na Nigeria eka Khapi ya Tinxaka ya Vavasati ya 2018 (AFCON) Bafana Bafana yi tlange ku ringana hi 1-1 eka meche wo hundzela emahlweni wa AFCON na NigeriaXipanu xa Rhagabi xa Afrika-Dzonga xa hoyozeriwa eka matirhelo ya xona naswona hi va navelela leswinene eka meche wa xona lowu taka na Wales hi siku ra 24 Hukuri
trg_text: to support the South African Automotive Masterplan (SAAM)The SAAM focuses on six areas: Local market optimisation; Regional market development; Localisation; Infrastructure development; Industry transformation, and Technology and associated skills developmentThe amendments seek amongst others to encourage higher levels of local value addition to create more opportunities for additional employmen

src_text: 2018.Khabinete yi kombela maAfrika-Dzonga ku ya emahlweni va seketela vatlangi va xinuna na va xisati va tik Nakambe Khabinete yi hoyozela:1 Holobye wa Sayense na Thekinoloji Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane, loyi vito ra yena ri boxiweke ku tirha eka Khansele ya Forau ya Ikhonomi ya Matiko ya Misava eka Ncinco wa Tifeme wa Vumune, lowu vumbiwaka hi mfumo vaaki lava nga na ku tsakela kun'we na swidyondzek Leswi swi ta pfuna matiko emisaveni hinkwayo ku angula na ku tirhisa hindlela leyi vuyerisaka swivandlanene leswi tisiwaka hi Ncinco wa Tifeme wa VumuneHolobye wa Timali Tito Mboweni eka ku thoriwa ka yena eka Bodo ya Valawulathirasiti ya Nkwama wa ku Rhula wa Misava, lowu wu nga ta nyika timali eka migingiriko ya xidipulomati yo lamula no sivela, swilaveko swa vuswikoti bya mihlangano, na mitirho yo seketela ku rhula eAfrik Tanihi xirho xa Bodo ya Vulawulathirasiti, Holobye Mboweni u ta hoxa xandla eka nkhomano wa xiqhinga na mafumelo lama antswisweke, na vuangameri bya swa timali na mafambiselo bya Nkwama wa ku Rhul
trg_text: Monitoring and evaluation of the programme and related industry trends are further enhanced to ensure progress towards the SAAM vision and objective

src_text: Ku thoriwa ka valawulathirasiti va Nkwama wa ku Rhula wa AU i gozakulu eka nsimeko wa ku nyikiwa ka timali ka ajenda ya AU, leswi swi nga xiphemu xa phurosese ya mpfuxeto wa mihlangano leyi yaka emahlweniHolobye wa Dyondzo ya le Henhla na Vuleteri Naledi Pandor, loyi a nga ta tlhomiwa Risiva ra Rixaka ra Furwa ra Sagwati ra Vuthu ra Nxiximo hi Ravuntlhanu, 30 Hukuri 2018.
trg_text: 1 Banyana Banyana won the prestigious Team of the Year Awar

src_text: Sagwati leri ri tekela enhlokweni mifikelelo na mitirho ya yena leyi nga erivaleni ya vutomi hinkwabyo eka ku kondletela na ku yisa emahlweni ntirhisano exikarhi ka Furwa na Afrika-Dzonga eka xiyenge xa Sayense na Thekinoloj Nkhuvu lowu wu ta khomeriwa endhawini ya vutshamo ya Muyimeri wa Furwa eka Afrika-Dzonga ePitor Lava thoriwekeLava thoriweke hinkwavo va fanele ku landzelela vutiyisisi bya mithwaso na mbhaso lowu fanelek Tinhloko ta swifundzakulu ta Ndzawulotsongo xa Vulavisisi bya Vugevenga bya Xirhangana (Hawks):1 Free State: Burigadiya Kubandran Moodley; na1 N'walungu-Vupeladymabu: Meja-Jenerala Dumisani Patrick Mboth Ku thoriwa hi vuntshwa ka Adv Makhosini Solomon Msibi tanihi CEO wa Khamphanikulu ya Malawulelo ya Nkhuluko wa le Magondzweni (RTMC).
